author: Rebecca Cohen
description: Jesus Guerrero, a hairstylist known for working with clients such as Kylie Jenner and Jennifer Lopez, died of pneumonia and a fungal infection, according to the County of Los Angeles Medical Examiner, likely complications from AIDS.
title: Celebrity hairstylist Jesus Guerrero died of pneumonia and fungal infection, likely complications from AIDS

author: Erik Ortiz
description: Diddy's ex-assistant says he 'brainwashed' her when she sent messages of support and love
title: Sean Combs' ex-assistant says he 'brainwashed' her when she sent messages of support and love

author: Suzanne Gamboa
description: Immigration advocates say they've been trying since 2024 to get details from DHS, which has increased DNA collections to the FBI's database by 5,000% since 2020.
title: Homeland Security stonewalling info on noncitizen DNA collection operation, lawsuit alleges

author: Jason Kane
description: Cole Schmidtknecht, 22, had insurance but couldn’t afford to refill his asthma inhaler after the cost jumped from $70 to more than $500 at his pharmacy.
title: He couldn't afford his inhaler when the price soared without warning — and died days later

author: Jennifer Jett
description: When South Koreans elect a president Tuesday, it will end months of domestic political turmoil — but their choice could change their relationship with the U.S.
title: The first task facing South Korea's next leader: Handling Trump

author: Bridget Bowman
description: New York Lt. Gov. Antonio Delgado launched a Democratic primary challenge against Gov.
title: New York Gov. Kathy Hochul gets a primary challenge from Lt. Gov. Antonio Delgado

author: The Politics Desk
description: The House-passed legislation for President Donald Trump’s domestic agenda is moving to the Senate, where Majority Leader John Thune, R-S.D., is facing a squeeze from opposing party factions about how to modify it.
title: Senate GOP leaders face spending squeeze on Trump's big bill: From the Politics Desk

author: Hugh Son, CNBC
description: The more Jamie Dimon worries, the better his bank seems to do.
title: This is why Jamie Dimon is always so gloomy on the economy

description: Acting District of Colorado U.S. Attorney J. Bishop Grewell outlines the federal and state charges against Mohamed Sabry Soliman for Sunday's attack in Boulder.
title: U.S. attorney outlines charges against Colorado attack suspect

author: Jonathan Vanian, CNBC
description: Uber said Monday that Pierre-Dimitri Gore-Coty, one of the company’s longest-tenured top executives and the head of is delivery business is leaving after almost 13 years.
title: Uber delivery chief Gore-Coty is leaving after almost 13 years at ride-hailing company

author: Ashley Capoot, CNBC
description: Elon Musk’s brain tech startup Neuralink has closed a $650 million funding round, the company announced Monday.
title: Elon Musk's Neuralink raises $650 million in fresh capital

author: Diana Olick, CNBC
description: After several years of deep distress, the beleaguered U.S. office market has reached an inflection point.
title: More office space is being removed than added for the first time in at least 25 years

author: Amelia Lucas, CNBC
description: Byron Allen is putting his broadcast TV stations up for sale.
title: Byron Allen puts broadcast TV stations up for sale

author: Erika Edwards
description: The CDC is urging Americans to make sure they’re protected against measles before traveling to other countries this summer.
title: Warning of overseas outbreaks, CDC urges Americans to get the measles vaccine before traveling abroad

author: Génesis Miranda Miramontes, NBC Los Angeles
description: The Los Angeles Police Department is asking for the public’s help to find a group of men who they say attacked a transgender woman over the weekend and are believed to be the same people who attacked her in April.
title: LAPD seeks group of men in another attack on a transgender woman

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: Marcelo Gomes Da Silva, 18, is in immigration detention after ICE arrested him on graduation weekend in Milford, where he's attended school since he was 6, friends said.
title: ICE arrest of H.S. student sends shockwaves through a Massachusetts town

description: Defense attorneys worked to discredit testimony from a former personal assistant to Sean Combs during his federal sex trafficking trial, noting her failure to mention multiple assault allegations during talks with investigators.
title: Sean Combs' former assistant returns to stand in sex trafficking trial

author: The Associated Press
description: Philadelphia Eagles star running back Saquon Barkley was announced Monday as EA Sports’ cover athlete for Madden NFL 26.
title: Eagles running back Saquon Barkley named cover star for Madden NFL 26

author: Kalhan Rosenblatt
description: Marc Maron announced Monday that he would end his acclaimed podcast, "WTF With Marc Maron," after nearly 16 years.
title: Marc Maron to end his 'WTF' podcast this fall

author: Viola Flowers
description: Jonathan Joss, the voice actor best known as John Redcorn from "King of the Hill," was killed in a San Antonio, Texas, shooting on Sunday, according to police.
title: Jonathan Joss, 'King of the Hill' voice actor, killed in San Antonio shooting

author: Mirna Alsharif
description: Air quality alerts remained in place Monday from Minnesota and Michigan to South Carolina due to smoke from wildfires in Canada.
title: Canadian wildfires trigger air quality alerts across the U.S.

author: Brooke Sopelsa
description: There were 932 anti-LGBTQ incidents across the United States over the past year — from hate speech and bomb threats to fatal violence — with more than half of these acts targeting transgender and gender-nonconforming people, according to GLAAD.
title: Trans people, local governments and educators face rising anti-LGBTQ hate, GLAAD report finds

author: The Associated Press
description: A transgender athlete bested the competition Saturday at the California high school track and field championship to take home gold in the girls high jump and the triple jump at a meet that has stirred controversy and drawn national attention.
title: Trans athlete wins two girls events at California track and field finals

author: Viola Flowers
description: John Brenkus, host and co-creator of ESPN's "Sport Science," died on Saturday, according to an announcement made on his X account Monday night.
title: John Brenkus, 'Sports Science' host and co-creator, dies at 54

author: The Associated Press
description: Sicily’s Mount Etna put on a fiery show Monday, sending a cloud of smoke and ash several kilometers (miles) into the air, but officials said the activity posed no danger to the population.
title: Sicily's Mount Etna erupts in a fiery show of smoke and ash miles high

author: Jason Abbruzzese
description: It was the fist slam heard 'round the chess world.
title: A move and a bang: Magnus Carlsen drops his first match against India's chess champion

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Monday declined to hear two major gun cases challenging a Maryland law that bans assault-style weapons, including the AR-15 semiautomatic rifle that has been used in high-profile mass shootings, and a Rhode Island restriction on large-capacity magazines.
title: Supreme Court denies challenges to laws banning assault-style weapons and high-capacity magazines

author: The Associated Press
description: Instead of judges being appointed on a system of merit and experience, Mexican voters are now choosing between some 7,700 candidates vying for more than 2,600 judicial positions.
title: Mexico's first judicial elections marked by low turnout, confusion and disillusionment

description: A federal judge had blocked the White House's broad "reduction in force" plan for government agencies.
title: Trump admin pushes for Supreme Court to allow mass federal layoffs

author: Linda Carroll
description: New evidence finds that the MIND diet lives up to its name, even when it is started later in life.
title: If you want to protect your brain, this diet beats the Mediterranean diet, new study suggests

author: Kalhan Rosenblatt
description: Summer looks a little different this year for some Americans who say they are dialing back their leisure activities and shopping sprees due to tariffs.
title: Some Americans are shifting their summer plans to avoid tariff price hikes

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Tom Llamas said he’s "excited" to take the helm of "Nightly News" and will live by his tenets of being "tough but fair" while reporting "without fear or favor."
title: Tom Llamas 'excited' and ready to put his stamp on 'Nightly News' as he takes over

author: The Associated Press
description: Cincinnati Reds star Elly De La Cruz played with a heavy heart on Sunday.
title: Reds star Elly De La Cruz homers after learning of his sister's death

author: The Associated Press
description: The U.K. will build new nuclear-powered attack submarines and create an army ready to fight a war in Europe as part of a boost to military spending.
title: Britain doubles down on defense boost with new fleet of nuclear submarines

description: Ukraine’s military carried out a massive counteroffensive using drones to attack air bases deep inside Russian territory. The strikes come just hours before the two sides were set to renew face-to-face peace talks. NBC’s Keir Simmons reports for TODAY.
title: Ukraine Launches Massive Drone Attack on Russian Air Bases

description: Eight people have been hospitalized, some with serious burns, after police say an alleged attacker unleashed a makeshift flamethrower into a peaceful crowd at a pedestrian mall in Boulder, Colorado. The weekly gathering called for the return of the remaining hostages in Gaza and law enforcement officials say the suspect shouted “free Palestine.” NBC’s Morgan Chesky reports for TODAY.
title: Man Arrested in Colorado Fire Attack on Israeli Hostage Advocates

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: The suspect in a fire attack in Boulder, Colorado, yelled “Free Palestine,” the FBI said.
title: Boulder fire attack suspect named and Ukraine claims massive strike on Russia: Morning Rundown

description: The woman who is only being referred to by a pseudonym, "Mia," has accused Combs of sexual assault and other physical violence.
title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs trial resumes with cross-examination of his former personal assistant

author: Alexander Smith
description: It was a stunning, audacious attack whose widespread effects are only just becoming clear.
title: Ukraine's massive drone attack deep inside Russia lays bare Putin's vulnerability

author: Eve Qiao
description: K-pop, which has been unofficially banned in China for almost a decade, may be on the verge of being allowed back in.
title: K-pop has been banned in China for almost a decade. Until now, maybe.

description: A Ramsey trade will now push $18.448 million in cap charges to 2026.
title: As of June 1, Jalen Ramsey trade became far more feasible

author: Sahil Kapur
description: WASHINGTON — Kenny Capps is a cancer patient who has been battling multiple myeloma for a decade.
title: Republicans face new pressure to extend expiring Obamacare tax credits

author: The Associated Press
description: Tulsa's new mayor has proposed a $100 million reparations plan to give descendants of the 1921 Tulsa Race Massacre scholarships and housing help.
title: Tulsa's new Black mayor proposes $100M trust to 'repair' impact of 1921 Race Massacre

author: The Associated Press
description: The death toll from devastating flooding in a market town in Nigeria’s north-central state of Niger rose to at least 200 on Sunday, a local official said.
title: At least 200 killed as floods submerge Nigerian trading hub

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: WASHINGTON — The beginning of June marks the start of the traditional monthlong ruling season at the Supreme Court, when the justices hand down decisions in their biggest and most contentious cases.
title: Trump overshadows Supreme Court as ruling season begins

author: The Associated Press
description: "Lilo & Stich" and "Mission: Impossible — The Final Reckoning" dominated the box office charts again after fueling a record-breaking Memorial Day weekend.
title: 'Lilo & Stitch' passes 'Sinners' to become 2nd highest grossing film of 2025

author: Peter Guo
description: China on Monday accused the United States of breaching the 90-day trade truce agreed by the world’s two largest economies, after President Donald Trump said it was Beijing that had “totally violated” the agreement.
title: China hits back at Trump, saying U.S. actions 'severely undermine' trade truce

author: Dennis Romero
description: Eleven people were hospitalized after being stabbed at a homeless services provider in downtown Salem, Oregon, on Sunday night, police said.
title: Suspect in custody after 11 stabbed at Oregon homeless services provider

author: The Associated Press
description: Conservative Karol Nawrocki has won Poland's weekend presidential runoff election, according to the final vote count.
title: Trump-backed conservative wins Poland's presidential election

description: Colorado coach Deion Sanders witnessed both of his sons plummet through the draft order.
title: Deion Sanders: Pre-draft attacks on Shedeur and Shilo "hurt"

description: "I saw this big fire go up," a witness, Brooke Coffman, described the scene during a fire-related attack on Israeli hostage advocates in Boulder, Colorado.
title: Witness describes the attack on Israeli hostage advocates in Colorado
